website_summaries.verdict: An inexpensive option that provides a lot of support along with a unique, fun look.
pros: Race car style that comes in a variety of color combos
Has padded arms (that flip up), a padded headrest, and contoured padded segments
Specifically designed to offer support and comfort for hours of gaming
cons: Some buyers felt that the chair becomes less comfortable over time
Assembly can be uneven (one side higher than the other), and the chair itself doesn't tilt back far enough

customer_reviews.title: If you're looking for a chair to sit in for 6-10 hours a day, this isn't it.
customer_reviews.text: Cushion compresses and stays like that after using it for a while. Still decent enough though. update: I went from 4 stars after the first couple weeks, to 3 stars about 2 months in, and now 7 months later, I'm giving it a 1 star. The cushion on this chair has just completely given up and has compressed into a thin, tough pancake. I ended up having to buy a seat cushion so my butt wouldn't hurt so much sitting on this. Do yourself a favor and buy an Alera Elusion chair instead. I got one at work, and its heavenly. Absolutely worth the $140 price tag compared to this junk chair at the cost of $100.
customer_reviews.author: Alfred Wu

customer_reviews.title: Nice chair.
customer_reviews.text: I've only been using this chair for a couple of days. I love the back support it offers and the amount of cushion it offers. It wasn't difficult to put together, but attaching the back of the chair to the arms was a little tricky doing it on my own, but I managed. I really like that the arm rests flip up. I just wished the seat could rise higher than it does. Overall, I'm quite satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: sw

customer_reviews.title: One of these chairs is not like the other...
customer_reviews.text: The grey chair I received Tuesday was full of padding and great lumbar support, the Blue chair, exact same model but different company I assume came today and was far inferior in comparison. It's a gamers chair designed to be comfortably sat in for 24hrs. I sit on the blue chair and it's like sitting on a board where I can feel my bones digging in. Extremely dissatisfied with this chair.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Sheffield

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and wide!
customer_reviews.text: I work from home and I like to sit crisscrossapplesauce in my chair, plus I’m kinda chunky so I searched and searched for a wide chair that wasn’t leather. So happy I found this one! Thank you all for your reviews! I love this chair and I love that the arm rests pivot. My husband bought a new chair at the same time but he spends all of his time in mine because it’s so comfy!
customer_reviews.author: MamaFlem

customer_reviews.title: but this chair was not very comfortable. Assembly wasn't too bad
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I got a off product from this company, but this chair was not very comfortable. Assembly wasn't too bad, and was a one man job of about 20 minutes. The features seemed to be decent: good price, fold up arms, tilt, solid design. But comfort overshadowed everything else for me. A very stiff and had ergonomics that did not fit my body/back at all. I'm 5'10 and 170lbs if that gives you a better idea. Your mileage may very, but I would keep looking if you were thinking of purchasing this one. Buy once, cry once.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: The Most Comfortable Chair in the House!!!
customer_reviews.text: I used to dread going into my home editing suite because of my old chair. This new chair is now the most comfortable chair in the house. I was really apprehensive about buying this chair from Amazon without trying it out like I would in a Brick and Mortar. For me, it was great purchase. I was surprised at the comfort at such a price point. It easy to assemble with parts aligned correctly. I remember old chairs that I that I really had to stretch thing to make parts fit. Now I have to go Archie Bunker on people who try to it in MY chair.
customer_reviews.author: Stan Y.

customer_reviews.title: very nice gaming chair!
customer_reviews.text: nice and cheap gaming chair! dont get me wrong, it is cheap to me but it doesnt cheaply build! it took me maybe 10 mins to assembly and boy the chair is really nice looking in person and solidly built! too bad it doesnt recline, but hey for the price theres nothing out there within this price range would give you more!
customer_reviews.author: Denny Ordinary

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable,  not enough of cushion support, good luck to assemble it
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for comfort - keep looking further! - There is not enough of cushion support (manufacturer did not have enough money for cushion support) - In addition, it's complicated to assemble (the holes on the chair and backrest piece not aligned ) - good luck to sweat around to assemble it!
customer_reviews.author: Entangled Э

customer_reviews.title: Overall poor quality
customer_reviews.text: To start with putting it together was more of a hassle than it should have been because the hole didn't match up with where the screw was supposed to go on two parts of the backing. I had to jury rig a new opening just to get it to fit properly. The arm rests are a scratchy fabric that isn't comfortable in the slightest, although the cushioning isn't bad. The chair itself doesn't have a proper back support, if you have your back against the chair you're perpetually leaning. The chair was only 100 but you get what you pay for and I wouldn't recommend this to anyone. I like the lime green though.
customer_reviews.author: JoMo

customer_reviews.title: Gas piston failed after 6 months no response from manufactorer
customer_reviews.text: This chair was great the first 6 months I had it. Then the gas piston started slowly sinking and after putting it at max height within about 30 mins it'll have sinked down to the minimum height. I'm not even a big guy at 190lbs. I contacted OFM and they said it was the piston and is covered under warranty. They replied almost instantly to my initial email. They asked for my address and amazon invoice. I replied with both. No response. almost a week later I emailed them again and again days later...no response...
customer_reviews.author: some other guy

customer_reviews.title: The chair is comfortable and sturdy but things start falling apart after a ...
customer_reviews.text: The chair is comfortable and sturdy but things start falling apart after a while. When the back comes loose it's no problem, you can tighten the screw. However, one of my arm rest cushions is coming loose from it's plastic base and there's no way for me to access the screw. Worth it though if you're looking for a fairly cheap ''gaming'' chair that will last a while with good care.
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: Feels sturdy but off balance and uneven
customer_reviews.text: Chair is ok. Looks ok. Stitching is off and design elements very out of alignment. Seat wobbles regardless of tension or construction tightness. Back does not align with seat. Seat does not sit straight. Chair wobbles wonky on the gas lift which is extremely sub par and barely supports anyone of our weights or heights. Sits uneven in all ways except for the excellent wheels and bottom metal parts. No possible way for me to get arm rests even height or even. Material on armrests scratches and dries elbow skin. I expect this quality from a $40 wish chair. Very disappointed. Major disappointment after spending weeks researching. Wish I could return it.
customer_reviews.author: Von

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, and has a pretty good lumbar support built ...
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable, and has a pretty good lumbar support built into the chair. Perfect if you are on the shorter side or have a short torso, as if you're super tall, your head would over the top of the chair. My only real complaint is that the seams where it goes from leather to the regular fabric seems a bit sloppy and isn't as crisp as the picture shows, but overall it still looks pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Usakiia

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I see some people complaining about the comfort, but I can't agree. It's very soft, amazing lumbar support, keeps your back straight comfortably so you don't get that burning between your shoulders. The assembly was a little tricky for the back piece but really not that bad overall. The arm rests raise up and down which is nice for getting up without turning all the way around! Definitely worth the money if you're looking for an inexpensive gaming chair.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Great chair for a great price
customer_reviews.text: Great chair for a great price. Not a gamer, I'm a software developer (Applying to Amazon Developer roles for over 2 years now). Installation was a little tedious but overall easy. Came in a nice packaging. I would suggest you put the arms onto the bottom of the seat, and the back before you insert it on the center rod.
customer_reviews.author: Sumanth

customer_reviews.title: feels comfortable to me anyway
customer_reviews.text: Had the chair for a few days now and so far I'm loving it! I've read the 1 star reviews and I have to really disagree. I do not feel any solid board or bolts jutting through the seat, feels comfortable to me anyway. Probably because my last chair was a hand-me-down that was a POS. I can agree that the holes were pretty hard to align but once I got it, it feels very solid to sit in, looks amazing and is comfortable. Does not look crooked and so far is solidly crafted. I will update if I have any problems with it.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband for his gaming. The colors are vibrant and the material is nice. The seat was soft but supporting. The head rest is at the perfect height for me and him. The arm rest are very comfortable. It took me about 20 minutes to assemble and that was simply because I have a broke toe so maneuvering is slightly difficult & I was watching tv inbetween setup. If I would have focused it would have been done in 10 mins or less. All the parts were there along with spare parts. I love this purchase. To bad they don't have more colors or else I would buy one for my self.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.Hamblin

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected.  My son loves it, great lumbar support.
customer_reviews.text: So I was not expecting much in a chair at this price point. But my son really wanted a gaming chair. I looked at a lot of different ones. This was not the best looking one, but it was the best one under 100 bucks with mostly good reviews. After getting it we built it, it went together quickly. It was so easy that I did not even need instructions. I am so glad that we got a chair with arm rests. It is so much easier for my 11 year old to get in and out of the chair from the side.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Dragon

customer_reviews.title: Fabric is scratchy, difficult to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Where to start? If I didn't order this online in the middle of a world-wide pandemic, I'd return it and go to any store to buy a new one. The armrests and seat cushion have a mesh fabric that is very scratchy against bare skin. The armrests are way too high for a regular desk chair if you're trying to type or use your mouse, but I guess it is a "gaming" chair. I purchased two, and my husband's chair had crooked screw holes so it was virtually impossible to assemble. I like to leave honest reviews to help customers out, and this is the first negative review I've written in a long time.
customer_reviews.author: SusyG

customer_reviews.title: Great Back Support
customer_reviews.text: So, I honestly picked this chair because it shipped the soonest and I had to get my home office set up immediately. My teen boys put it together for me in about 40 mins and had no trouble. I have to say that I didn't think I would like it at first. BUT, I am pleasantly surprised at how great it feels on my back. I have bulging disks at L5-L6 and I have no pain sitting in this chair. You can't see it from the pic, but there is very very firm lumbar support. For the price, I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: WilGeek77

customer_reviews.title: Sure my butt is comfy, but my elbows are thrilled!
customer_reviews.text: I searched a ridiculously long time for a new chair, and I've purchased tons over the years. Every time I do there's so many to choose from it's another overwhelming task. This one turned out great, but what I didn't count on working beyond perfectly were the arms that move upwards. My workspace/keyboard is oddly high compared to my seating position, and since the arms swing up and have good resistance to movement they rest my elbows perfectly and position my arms right where I need for hours of doing my awful, tedious job. Score!
customer_reviews.author: The Awesome "K"

customer_reviews.title: I installed a dishwasher faster and easier
customer_reviews.text: Is comfortable once together. Fabric is a bit ruff if you plan on sitting in it in shorts it hurts. Trying to get the bolts in for the arm rest was almost impossible. If I knew how long this was going to take to set up I would not have bought it. The screws didnt line up with where they should go. Cant adjust back so not great for gaming. I'd give this chair a 3 out of 10.
customer_reviews.author: Aly

customer_reviews.title: Good for the First 2 weeks then went down hill
customer_reviews.text: Great at First then after about 2 weeks the arms started to wobble, the cushioning in the seat would just stay flat and it felt like I was just sitting on a piece of wood with screws in it. The back had great cushioning and was great for your posture. But was not expecting such a break down after 2 weeks of use. Got it for a great price (under $60) but even then it was not bearable to use. I weigh 210 so I was 40lbs under max weight but still wouldn't suggest it for anybody over 180lbs
customer_reviews.author: RAC

customer_reviews.title: does not tilt, leans forward
customer_reviews.text: i was looking for a replacement for my office chair. the seller did not represent this chair correctly on the amazon page. the chair assembled looks nice. the mesh is fine, seemed sturdy. the problem was it said it tilts. this chair DOES NOT. This chair also leans forward too much. its on a slight angle and it only adjusts further forward for some reason. i would not recommend for an office, not sure who would use this chair if it doesn't tilt and leans so far forward. I had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Flax

customer_reviews.title: 2nd one we bought!
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd one I've bought (1 green, 1 red). Absolutely love for a comfortable gaming chair for my boys. Super easy to put together. My 8 yo pt his together in under an hour, and I only helped with putting the back on. The other one we have had for 3 months. While the green fabric is starting to pill on the left arm rest where his arm rubs it, it's easy to shave off, and looks good as new. For the price, I have no complaints. I was just gonna get them each a basic desk chair, but decided I might as well spend 30 more and get cool, nicer ones. Glad I did!
customer_reviews.author: Patriot

customer_reviews.title: Buy it
customer_reviews.text: Awesome chair, took a bit to put together by myself, just make sure the adjustment lever is on the right hand side of the seat otherwise it will be tilted forward, easy 2 minute fix though. Really comfy, I'm only 5'8 and 130lbs so I can't say this is great for anyone larger but its a BIG chair compared to regular computer chairs I've had in the past. I really expect this to last more than a few months with the cushion especially.
customer_reviews.author: Sebastian Powers

customer_reviews.title: Decent cheap chair
customer_reviews.text: Probably worth what I paid - $67. Not the most cushiony seat, some of the stitching is already loose, and the fabric doesn't seem very sturdy. The Frame of the chair is probably alright... but the back attaches via the armrests, so it isn't adjustable, which I don't mind. I think the back of this chair isn't vertical enough; when you're sitting at the desk there is a good 5" between my back and the chair, and I'm not a thin wisp of a person.
customer_reviews.author: L. Wicks

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and Supportive
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -Very comfortable -Nice lumbar support -Great head rest for 5'11 male -Material seems to be durable -Movable arm rests Cons: -None as of now! Overall: This is a great computer and or gaming chair. The seat is comfortable and cushioned well. The back support is nice with the high head rest. The arm rests move up so you can lazily play games until your hearts content! The camo print looks sharp! No more numbing of the bottom!
customer_reviews.author: BrittandtheBeach

customer_reviews.title: Liked it so much that I bought another
customer_reviews.text: Got the green and black one on sale a while back to replace my 15-year-old gaming chair that was duct taped together. Even though it was dirt cheap, the quality says otherwise. I ended up with the need for an additional office desk in the house, so I grabbed one of these chairs in black and gray. Put it together in about 15-20 minutes and now I love it just as much as the orginal one. A little stiff at first, but it's breaking in nicely with use. I recently had back surgery so the bucket style seat with the high back is an absolute must have for me. Highly recommended office/gaming chair.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Bad merchandise!!
customer_reviews.text: 1st thing I think I have ever received that is bad!! I have spent a lot of money on Amazon an I am truly disappointed in this purchase. Plastic piece broke, screw broke off inside hole that it was being screwed in and leather on chair sewn very bad, looks like it's getting ready to come apart in areas. A Christmas present for my husband that I am ashamed to give!! :(
customer_reviews.author: lborden4

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money for long periods at a desk and back pain
customer_reviews.text: I got this chair because I have bulging disks in my lower back and lots of problems with my back, neck and shoulder. This chair is amazing for that! It has good lumbar and neck support and is pretty hard so I don’t need to worry about slouching great buy! I had some trouble putting the arm rests together because of the pain in my shoulders. Took more time to put the one arm rest on than the whole rest of the chair. It works better with two people.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Marie

customer_reviews.title: The Arms
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for the bae-bae. He likes sitting cross-legged, so the lifting arms were a HUGE plus. There were no rips or tears in the fabric when we received it, there's very little bounce when it's locked in, and the actual seat for it is much bigger in person, which also works well for his L moments. He still bought a cushion for his butt, but it could just be because he's so bony, so. My butt comes pre-cushioned so I thought it was fine. Especially for the price, it's an excellent chair so far.
customer_reviews.author: Zetsubel

customer_reviews.title: So far so good...
customer_reviews.text: Received the chair today. 20 minute assembly time. No problems. All parts available, all fit fine. VERY comfortable. The seat and back seem to be adequately padded, will see in time how much they compress but right now... perfect. Fit & finish is good. Looks good. The only complaint I have is that the price dropped $10 since I ordered it. I wonder if Amazon or the seller will rebate the difference? That would be sweet. Every little bit helps with finances, eh?
customer_reviews.author: JimmyGuitar

customer_reviews.title: Great, Sturdy chair for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great chair, very comfortable. The moveable arms are a nice touch. I am a big person and I feel comfortable in this chair, and it adjusts to the perfect height to work comfortably at a desk. One tip- when putting the chair together, ignore the instructions and build one side of the chair first. Attach the back to the arms first then connect to the base one side at a time. It will reduce your frustration during assembly.
customer_reviews.author: Robtvla

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality. Lasts for years.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second exact chair like this. The first one was my brothers for years before he gave it to me. Thing is about 5 years old and still in perfect shape. I only bought another one because my roommate borrowed it and I wanted a different color. I was so excited when I found the same chair but in purple. So she got to keep the old one. The first one was blue. The chair is easy to assemble except for getting the back on. I’m not sure how you could do that with one person. Amazing chair for the quality. Similar chairs are 200-300 dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke K.

customer_reviews.title: It's as ok as ok gets
customer_reviews.text: The chair arrived on time, no damaged pieces, and was easy to assemble (only took about 30 minutes by myself). The lumbar support is nice, and the upper part of the chair cradles your shoulder blades nicely. It's also nice that the arms fold up so I can roll it up to my desk to save space. The seat cushion isn't anything special. There is no headrest, and minimal recline. After about a month, the support is already showing some signs of decline, so I don't imagine any back support will be left after about a year. Still, the chair is working for me and my herniated disk, but I only sit for 3-5 hours a day in it.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Chair
customer_reviews.text: This is the best chair I have ever purchased. The price was a lower then others, but the quality is high and it is very comfortable. I really like the fact that I can raise the arms if I wish. I also likes the looks and it the green and black scheme goes great with my custom built PC, keyboard and mouse. I have had 2 lower back surgeries and the lumbar support is perfect and I can sit in this chair for many hours.
customer_reviews.author: ultra55371d

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I’ve never been able to get a chair I wanted while growing up then as an adult I had ones that were given to me so why spend money if I don’t have to. Well this time around especially during quarantine, I work at my desk 9-6 and then game at my same desk all night long... I needed something to support me. So far this chair has been incredibly comfortable, beyond easy to set up and the lift Away arm rests were the best decision by far.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Del Re

customer_reviews.title: Chair is comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: This chair looks awesome and is very comfortable to sit in. The fact that the arms can be raised up is great. My biggest problem is the purple fabric. It is like some type of mesh fabric and is VERY uncomfortable on bare skin (like if you're wearing shorts). I just threw a sheet over the seat of the chair and it's fine. It won't be a problem when wearing pants either. Otherwise the chair is great!
customer_reviews.author: Nikoa K.

customer_reviews.title: Decent chair, but not worth $100
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty comfy chair. I love the high back. I feel though its not as good as it should be for the price. It rocks slightly from Side to side after a week of use. I made sure everything is tightened. Overtime it will probably get worse. I am a fairly handy person, however some assembly was a pain. Mainly the arms were very hard to attach. I have spent less for better chairs.
customer_reviews.author: Erin M.

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this chair as an affordable option while working from home. In the short amount of time I have had it, it has been phenomenal! Prior to purchasing I was a little skeptical because many of the reviews mentioned how difficult it is to assemble. That being said, I completely understand how people would have trouble if the follow the printed instructions. Assemble the chair and then put it on the piston and wheels and you will save so much time because you aren’t dealing with the base moving as you are putting the arm rests and back on. Overall it’s a great chair for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: After assembly the chair has served us fine. The padding is a little firm. Alright, going to come back to assembly. You get what you pay for and assembly for this chair was a royal pain in the ass. The screws that connect the back of the chair to the arm rest threads are not quality. You end up find the chair to come together and the threading isn't any good. I spent about a solid hour fiddling with this chair in order to finally get it assembled. The Amazon Basics chair I also purchased was so much easier to put together. It will do and hoping I never have to take this chair apart ever again.
customer_reviews.author: 40rty

customer_reviews.title: Pain to assemble, not worth the effort.
customer_reviews.text: Putting this together has been a nightmare. I tried once and it just wouldn't work so we had to get a replacement and this one was a pain to assemble. Either I have awful luck or it's just not a good time. You NEED two people and even then, prepare to get angry and curse out the manufacturer. Secondly, this chair seems to wobble a lot side to side and I don't feel entirely stable on it. It just doesn't seem like it was made well and I'm not sure it's going to stand up to time. I feel like it might fall apart at any second. I would recommend going for a different chair.
customer_reviews.author: Broderick Lemke

customer_reviews.title: The chair is pretty comfortable. The lumbar "support" pushes my lower back ...
customer_reviews.text: The chair is pretty comfortable. The lumbar "support" pushes my lower back way out there and the shoulders feel too far back. Otherwise, it is comfortable. I like the cloth to help it breath. And the raisable arms are great! I did have some problems putting it together. Some of the screws didn't want to line up with the holes. But with a little effort, it worked and the chair is sturdy. Some of the stitching isn't centered which made me question if the chair was assembled crooked or not. But we'll see how it lasts!
customer_reviews.author: Ian McGuire

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable, hard to assemble, and poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: I should have stopped assembly when I noticed the bent mounting point on the back of the chair, but I didn't. I put the whole thing together (minus 1 screw on the back), and discovered that this chair might be okay if you enjoy leaning far back all day. But if you sit remotely upright, the absolutely MASSIVE lumbar support pushes the rest of your back so far away from the chair that it doesn't make contact. I'm going to repair my 20 year old office chair because that has WAY more comfort and support than this. Plus there's an actual, usable back on it.
customer_reviews.author: That Guy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together even for those of us who ...
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together even for those of us who can be instructionally challenged. The chair is very comfortable with enough padding for a full days use. If putting it together yourself try putting the chair on its side or different positions to make it easier to line the pieces up and don't tighten any one screw all the way until you have all the screws for that part started, then tighten all the screws a bit at a time to keep everything even.
customer_reviews.author: Debra

customer_reviews.title: Good chair
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use as a new office chair as I'd been working from home for a month and it was clear my old one was junk. This arrived quicker than expected last weekend and it assembled nicely as well. I like the shape, good back support, the adjustments work well. But I have a couple of things that dropped it a star. The chair seat height doesn't drop quite as low as I'd like, at least without shoes. And the "leather" (not sure if it's real) seems strong and it stitched well, but it gets hot after a bit. Neither are deal-breakers and overall I'm very happy with this chair!
customer_reviews.author: Doktor Bill

customer_reviews.title: Overall Good Gaming Chair
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised with how good the chair was for the price. There is some slop in the arm rests, but that is because they screw directly into the soft base and back. I wish there was more lumbar support, as you have to really lean into the chair before you get any support at all. Overall though the chair was worth the price I paid for it and the pieces seem like they are sturdy enough to last a few years. Is it the greatest chair ever? No. Is it worth a fraction of a quality gaming chair's cost? Yes indeed. Look for this chair if you want a good chair for around $100.
customer_reviews.author: A. Dorman

customer_reviews.title: In the hot seat
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent chair that went together easily enough, provides ok support and feels sturdy enough for my not-getting-any-thinner-during-the-lockdown bod. When I started working from home I appropriated my child's mesh desk chair. But I needed to return it, so I got this one. We live in a warm place, and going from mesh to this, I'm suffering from swamp-a** right about now. A microfiber towel covering the seat helps some, but the material and foam don't breathe very well. If your climate is warm and humid, do yourself a favor and shop for a mesh-seated chair.
customer_reviews.author: Halcyon

customer_reviews.title: 6 Months old already sandbagging
customer_reviews.text: **UPDATE - Purchased in March 2018 its Sept now 6 months and the chair is already sandbagging. The chair looks very nice, and is pretty comfortable for the most part. When installing I would suggest putting some threadlock on the screws iv been using the chair for about a month and had to go back and retighten several screws. My main complaint is the chair doesn't lean back quite far enough needs just a few more degrees of tilt, I cant lean back in the chair and it stay back on its own with just my weight I have to put my foot on something to hold it back.
customer_reviews.author: Pinskeel

customer_reviews.title: Chair broke
customer_reviews.text: After less than 2 weeks in this chair, the back of it broke off. All the screws were tight and it looks like they came out of the bottom of the seat. I ended up throwing it away because I heard the company was not very helpful and I don't have the time to waste. So I went back to my old chair. Its very upsetting that in times like these, you cannot rely on companies. As a disabled veteran, I would expect more from companies. I only weigh 220lbs so no reason the chair should have broke. I would like a new chair sent if anyone from this company y reads these reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Courtney

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS CHAIR.  It is NOT for typing/PC gaming.
customer_reviews.text: If you want a comfortable chair for PC gaming/typing/working from home, this is NOT the chair for you. It is constantly tilted back with NO adjustment for that. It is in a constantly reclined position (slightly but still enough to merit its uselessness). Right now I'm sitting in it, straining to simply lean forward and type on the keyboard. No tilt adjustment. Only up/down. You will need to stack pillows behind your back for support because the back (as I sit now) is literally 2 feet away from my shoulders.
customer_reviews.author: This

customer_reviews.title: Great budget chair
customer_reviews.text: I'll open by saying assembly is horrible. It is quite troublesome. Once it is assembled and working, it is wyite a decent chair. Fairly comfortable, although the leather and fabric hybrid feels dofferent, it is still good. Gives it a cool look. Armrests are not its best feature. They are rough, but not horrible. The ergonomic design for the back is great, considering the price. Overall, there are countless chairs out there which are better. Now then, if you want so same some money and buy something cheaper, but good, this is the way to go. Defineatly beats any other chair in the same price range.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Fuentes

customer_reviews.title: Poor back support.
customer_reviews.text: With many of us working from home these days, I desperately needed a chair that would support my back over the long hours of computer work I do every day. This chair seemed nice and reasonably priced, so I got it. To my great disappointment, though it looks very nice and feels comfortable to sit on, the back support is not good at all. The angle of the chair renders the back support useless. To get my back supported, I need to practically recline. Disappointed! Had I known that this chair is not as adjustable, I would have opted to spend more money and buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: OnlineShopper

customer_reviews.title: Looks pretty decent - turned out to be GARBAGE!
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent looking chair, and the price was right (since work was making the purchase for me). The problem is, it isn't nearly as comfortable as my previous office chair was. I spend in excess of 10-16hrs at my desk for work and I should have purchased something with more cushion. Now, I'm going to use the components of this chair to convert a car bucket seat into an office chair. Update. The shock collapsed and now won't stay put. Seat instantly crashed to the bottom. The bottom bracket is very wobbly and doesn't allow adjustment, even if completely removed from seat bottom. Garbage. Don't waste your money. Spend it elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Hector Q.

customer_reviews.title: Really nice chair for the price
customer_reviews.text: It is comfortable, but lacks some of the adjustments you find with pricey chairs. Easy to put together took all of 20 minutes. Think to note when putting the arms of the chair on make sure to pull the fabric down over the receiver nuts on the back and seat. Grandson really liked it for his gaming! Ergonomics so so, I have my grandson use a small pillow when playing games as he not able to adjust the back of the chair straighter. For the price I am very happy with this purchase. Everything considered I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great chair, horrible pain to assemble!
customer_reviews.text: There are several tools to keep nearby during assembly. A spouse/friend/other than is oblivious to cuss words, band-aids and lots of alcohol! Knowing where to put things is easy to figure out even if you don't have the directions. I would keep the wheels off till the very end to this creature does not roll away from you and do not tighten the bolts till they are all in enough to not pop out. Anyways, on to the good points, this chair has a great warranty, awesome lumbar support, and is a great value. I got mine (green mesh) on sale for less than $70! I also like that it sits higher :)
customer_reviews.author: Fernole

customer_reviews.title: Hmm
customer_reviews.text: First its made in China and I tried not to judge until using it. Instructions are very easy if you're photo coordinated Back peice and side arms are a hassle installing but with a little help it's easy. So be careful not to bend or strip screw holes. Cheap leather but is stiff should break in good, sitching is single stitched so long lasting in this item is questionable. One screw cap missing, then one of the covers that pops in wasn't round so hsd too jam that in. But overall im loving it so far. Love the color reasonable price fast shipping csme 4 hours early.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmehundead

customer_reviews.title: You may not need to spend hundreds of dollars on the perfect chair.
customer_reviews.text: This went together very easily. The cushion is very pliable, this is not a hard seat so if you need that kind of support look elsewhere. The chair is comfortable, does not feel cheap, and is priced actually lower than the quality deserves, it's a great deal. You may be on the fence about buying that perfect gaming chair for your setup and are unsure of what you want to spend your money on. What I would recommend is that you buy this chair while you decide and there is a good chance you may not need to spend hundreds of dollars on something else once you have this one.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew M. Dillow

customer_reviews.title: Took more than an Allen wrench to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: Nice chair but what a pain to set up. My advice, start with the seat first and have some help you. Thread the screws and leave loose until all of them are installed and then start tightening down. One of the arm fasteners was not machined right and I stripped a screw trying to thread it in. Luckily, there are spares included. I grabbed my tap and die set and retapped the faster until it was smooth. Got everything installed and snug. Dropping stars for the quality of the assembly, and the probability of a return because of the poor machined parts used.
customer_reviews.author: Hypnosis4U2NV

customer_reviews.title: Awesome chair!
customer_reviews.text: My 15 yr old son got this for Christmas and he loves it! Better yet, it was easy enough that he put it together himself. I did have a problem with the shipping but I won't dock the chair stairs because I'm sure it was the delivery person's fault. One of the wheels was literally sticking out of the box. Thank goodness the packaging inside was ok because it was handled so roughly that it popped a hole right through the cardboard! I'll update later if any problems arise from the chair, but so far it was the hit of Christmas presents.
customer_reviews.author: Michele H

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it! Defective! I got a bad one I think
customer_reviews.text: I am only giving this one star because the last part of the assembly is a mess I am so freakin disappointed!!! When you put in the last 4 screws the holes do NOT line up I’ve been here for hours trying to do this and now the chair is all scratched up from me trying to put those last 4 screws in the leather is ripped from trying to line up the holes and the screws over and over! what a rip off!! I had to hand it off to someone else to attempt this impossible task because by the end of it I’m covered in sweat and frustrated! 😟
customer_reviews.author: AmandaPanda89

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: The product is cheap and you can tell. The leather is very soft and it has a visible stress mark on the rear of it from where my package was shipped. The factoey drilled holes did not line up appropriately, and that happened on both chairs that I had received. I had to send original back due to a hole in the fabric. For the money this chair is ok, but I’d your looking for something you are going to spend a lot of time in, this isn’t it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: So I got this chair over a year ago and already I am having issues. The two most glaring is that my butt started to hurt if I sit on this chair for too long. I had to get a cushion just to not have crippling pain after a while because the cushioning got so packed out. The next problem is that occasionally the chair will not stay on the highest setting and start to sink. I would recommend you pay a bit more for a more sturdy office/computer chair.
customer_reviews.author: Jaytrade

customer_reviews.title: Unable to recline! Takes a few set of hand and good amount of time to assemble!
customer_reviews.text: Unable to recline! Takes a few set of hand and good amount of time to assemble! The knob 4 reclining just turns and unfortunately the chair does not recline it's like it's stuck in the straight-up position. Tried several different things made sure it was assembled correctly so far no luck reclining it going on over a week now. :( I must say if it worked properly I would have given it 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: womansworth

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Inlove this new chair. Although it Reclined back and stays in an upright position for the most part it is very comfortable for me I said at my desk and I work from home so my 8 hour day now feels Very comfortable. Effort I wasn't gonna give it more than one star because it didn't come with instructions until I looked at the parts and it was pretty self explanatory After I read the wording under each screw telling you exactly where each one Needed to go
customer_reviews.author: MzsChapel

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I am happy with my chair. There were some issues that I didn't care for. My box was torn on multiple places and open when I got it if the porch. The instructions were not easily located and the pieces that needed to be screwed in or not lined up properly with the holes of the materials that had to be attached. I was able to finally get out to work but I had to finagle it and make some adjustments. The chair is very comfortable and for the price I'm still happy but it was a little frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: A Mills

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made, won't last, not comfortable for more than 30 minutes
customer_reviews.text: The chair, once assembled, is so flimsy I don't even feel safe sitting in it. It leans to one side. The "Bonded Leather" is basically a strip of throw-away leather at the outer seat bolster, but the rest of the chair is cheap faux leather that's so delicate it starts wearing through almost immediately. When you recline in the chair you can hear the pressboard inside the back of it crack. This is some Wish quality furniture. Pros: price, looks nice. Cons: flimsy and unstable, cheap materials start falling apart almost immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Aragon C. Etzel

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This chair is great for my back. I use it at my desk in my home office where I am 99% of the time. I have tried many more expensive models that are supposed to have back support but this one works great. The only issue I have is that being a short small frame female the seat is so deep I can not sit all the way back in it without the seat being past where my knee bends even if I lower the seat all the way. I would only ask for a somewhat not so deep seat.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Amerson-White

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but not cat proof
customer_reviews.text: The chair looks good and goes together easy as my 12 year old put the chair together. It's very comfortable to sit in for several hours doing school work or gaming. The only problem we have had so far is keeping the cats from thinking it is their new scratching pad :-)
customer_reviews.author: Charlene

customer_reviews.title: Difficult Set up
customer_reviews.text: I gave this chair a 3 because it was extremely difficult to set up. What was originally a good birthday present for my boyfriend turned into a 90 minute nightmare. Three months later, the quality of the chair is still great & it's super comfortable; however, none of the holes and screws lined up when we were putting it together. Had to finagle the crap out of it in order to put it together. Almost gave up at one point.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Karas

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable (assuming you get all the pieces)
customer_reviews.text: Missing a lot of parts (27 to be exact). All the nuts & bolts, wheels, & seat post. Had to pack all of it back up after 10 mins. Now wait for a replacement chair. Picture is all I got in the box. ** Upgraded from 1 star to 4 stars. After three weeks I finally got the replacement chair (with all the pieces). The back was a bit difficult to attach. After it was all put together, it was very comfortable. Like that the armrests can fold up & the whole seat can lean back a little bit.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler V.

customer_reviews.title: I like it!
customer_reviews.text: I knew the box was going to be big and once inside the house the pieces came out easily and the instructions almost clear enough. It is supposed to be a tight fit and wasn't as easy as it first looked but it did go together. Only when I first sat in the finished product did I realize what a good value it was and well worth the effort and muttering to get it put together. I spend a lot of time at my desk and this chair fits all of my contours in very adequate comfort. And as I am not as young as I once was the arms are just right to launch me up when necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Douglass

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: The chair looks amazing, my daughter loved it for her birthday (11yo). She loves sitting in it at her loft bed desk and doing her random stuff she does. Putting it together though was a B****. It took two adults an hour to get the arms to line up perfectly so the screws would go in, they kept slipping out of the groove. Did some with a small tear in the head rust, but we knew we bought a damaged box too, so whatever. No one else has noticed it but me. Otherwise the quality is good.
customer_reviews.author: Francisco Morales

customer_reviews.title: Seat becomes hard to sit on. Don't buy.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because of the look which is great! But the quality of the chair itself is horrible. The main issue is the foam quality of the seat itself and the armrests. The seat foam became flat after only a few months which goes to show how low quality the materials are. It's NOT ideal for long term gaming or computer work or anything that involves a human bottom sitting on it. To add insult to injury, the arm rest foams starts getting flat and sliding sideways off the plastic arm rest it's supposedly attached to. Simply put: Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: OldeWolf

customer_reviews.title: Low quality and cheap
customer_reviews.text: Warning: this is not all bonded leather. The parts that are different color are a thin mesh that tears super easy. Mine tore during assembly which is a whole other issue. The back is held on by the arms, which are held on by 4 screws. Two to seat and two to back. There is NO adjustments to the back, the tilt has zero control. It’s all tilt, no option to lock the tilt. Spend money elsewhere. The screws barely go in, getting them aligned to start moving was not the easiest. Edit: after sitting in it and the tilt not locking it was decided to be returned.
customer_reviews.author: aG

customer_reviews.title: the green material is easy to snag
customer_reviews.text: falls apart fast, starts making weird clunking sounds after 8 or 9 months. needs complete replacement after 1-2 yrs. the green material is easy to snag, rip and tear, and it soaks up dirt like a sponge and is also hard / impossible to clean. the "leather" is bonded leather, meaning left over leather powder is bonded to plastic with some binders. its very poor quality and I don't think it should be called leather. while it is a step up from Naugahyde, I cant say its desirable. the posture is good, and it is a comfy chair. just not worth 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: justink

customer_reviews.title: Large chair that doesn't last long.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son's 17th bday. You definitely need another person to help assemble it. My son it because it was big, green and pretty comfortable because it's big enough for him. (He's 6'2, 215lbs) It lasted a whole 2 months before the screws for the arm to attach to the back of the chair and the seat snapped off into them, so we couldn't get the screws out in order to reattach. Then, not even a week later, the bottom of the chair broke off & fell out as well. Really kinda bummed to pay so much for a chair that doesn't even last long.
customer_reviews.author: Lauryn

customer_reviews.title: Great for short people!
customer_reviews.text: Compared to my husband’s ~$400 Secret Lab chair I feel like this was a good buy. I’m 5’2” and most gaming chairs are way too big putting support in the wrong places, especially the lumbar support, this chair fits my frame extremely well but I’m unsure of how comfortable a much taller person would find it. It’s not the highest quality, but for its price point and style I’m happy with it, I don’t find the material rough at all like some have mentioned.
customer_reviews.author: BUSINESS MAN

customer_reviews.title: Not adequate for long-term sitting
customer_reviews.text: While it is a good value for the price, the seat support speaks to the poor quality of the chair. The seat base has little cushion support and after 20 minutes of sitting I began to shift uncomfortably. I found it necessary to add a separate pad on the seat if I wanted to continue sitting. I get it that this is a cheaply made chair but I would recommend the the manufacturer concentrate adding more support cushioning to the seat to really improve the ergonomic value of this chair.
customer_reviews.author: Al Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Son very happy with this chair!!
customer_reviews.text: My son picked out this chair so we bought it for him for a gift. Easy to put together with the exception of one part that took 2 people only because one person had to hold while the other person attached the part so the chair wouldn't move. My son uses the chair daily and he said it is comfortable, he likes that it reclines and also likes the fact that the back is higher for his head. His previous desk chair was much shorter. Well constructed and looks like it will hold up for quite some time.
customer_reviews.author: Jode

customer_reviews.title: He wants to do homework?!?!?!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son to double as a homework office chair and gaming chair. He loves it!! I knew he would love it for gaming but was surprised how excited he was to do his homework in his super cool chair. Easy to put together and sturdy! He is a little light to make the chair lower with out me pushing it down for him, but not a big deal. I like that the arms lift up to be able to roll and fit under any table/desk he sits at (he rolled the chair all over the house and used it at every table) Great versatile chair! recommend for kids 10+
customer_reviews.author: Kara Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good, but came damaged
customer_reviews.text: So far, this chair is comfortable for the most part. It could definitely use a little more cushion, but then again, I could use less cushion myself. The box was a little damaged when I got it and immediately upon taking everything out of the box, I saw the damage to one of the legs that is shown in the picture included. Also, putting it together alone was a little bit tougher than I expected, but it didn't take long when I put it together in the order that I felt worked better than the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth & Angelique

customer_reviews.title: I use this for a work chair - looks good, but my butt hurts
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my son, but when he left for the military, I took it over for my work chair. It looks good, and I find the back is very, very well designed and comfortable, but sitting at my computer for long hours, my fat butt hurts. The seat needs more cushioning on the bottom, or perhaps a stretch fabric bottom, like the Herman Miller office chair . Or maybe it's not made for 55 year old men weighing 225 pounds. That said, it's way cheaper than a $500 Herman Miller chair - but maybe for a work chair you should spend $500? Herman Miller chairs are widely used for good reason.
customer_reviews.author: James T. Barringer

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: My son assembled my chair quickly and without difficulties. The seat padding is adequate and doesn't seem hard as others have suggested. The only things that don't get it a 5 star rating are that the back could be adjustable rather than just tilt, and a little cushier seat. I'm very happy with this chair and think it is excellent value for the price. I would recommend this and buy it again. My second choice with a little more cushion was almost $100 more and that's not worth it to me. I can sit in this chair for many hours without a problem.
customer_reviews.author: rnpilot

customer_reviews.title: Not long lasting
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as an office chair for working from home full time. I purchased it in March of 2019 so I've had it about 18 months. A couple months ago the left arm broke off and can't be put back on and the adjustable gas tube to move it up and down is now failing to hold the chair up. I'm faced with trying to decide to fix this chair or buy a new one. It wasn't an expensive chair, but I shouldn't have wasted my money.
customer_reviews.author: K. Latimer

customer_reviews.title: Decent chair but not very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: The chair comes with everything you need to build it. instructions are easy to follow. the holes weren’t lined up properly, so when it was all built one hole was punctured too high to even put the screw in. it’s a bit hard, so if you like squishier and softer chairs this is not the chair for you. if you like more firmness with support, this is worth the money. i won’t complain too much, since it was only $65 when i purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Ace

customer_reviews.title: Makes working from home much better
customer_reviews.text: After a few days of "work from home" due to COVID I realized that I should have given as much thought to my computer chair as i did for all the other chairs in the house. Stuck at the house and stores were closed but Amazon got me the chair in 2 days! I can now work all day without the back and leg cramps I had with my old chair. Highly recommended chair and props to Amazon for getting it to me in 2 days when everything around me was shut down.
customer_reviews.author: CajunBlade

customer_reviews.title: Gaming Birthday Present
customer_reviews.text: This was a birthday present for my son who needed a new gaming chair. He picked this out after having read the reviews for a number of chairs. After 8 months of heavy use the chair still looks good and performs well. It was easy to put together and seems to be holding up. It stays comfortable after hours and hours of use. My son is not a large person, so a person 180 lbs or larger may have different results - just something to consider, I have no facts to base this on. So far, we are happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Becky Wing

customer_reviews.title: Stiff and Thin Padding, Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I was unhappy with this chair the minute I sat in it. The seat is completely flat with very little padding and it is horribly uncomfortable. The seat is also on the small side as if it was made for a smaller person. I am 6' 1" and I feel like I'm too big for it. The only reason i didn't give it one star was because it has great lumbar support. It looks really cool though!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Buckner

customer_reviews.title: Got this chair for myself then got one for my bf
customer_reviews.text: Its prolly the BEST chair you could ever ask for, ive never had a problem with it being too hot and Its very soft to sit in. Honestly my cats have completely destroyed the top of it and I STILL love it. Its managed to keep my fat butt happy. Its chunky people friendly (trust me im a hefty girl) I spend roughly 5 hours a day in the chair on week days and on the weekends at LEAST 12 hours. We are heavy gamers so the computers are our life. We also convinced our bosses to get some of these chairs for our workplace and they love it too
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Do you need a gaming chair??
customer_reviews.text: i would recommend if you do buy this put the chair together before putting on the stand because it wont stop moving around and make it rather difficult for you to finish. very comfy, looks really good, love that the arms fold up makes it easy for me to slide it under my desk. great chair for its price. needs some more cushioning for where you sit but other than that great chair for gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Sommer

customer_reviews.title: Solid entry level gaming chair but a PAIN to assemble
customer_reviews.text: This was my first Gaming Chair, and overall I'm pretty happy with the purchase. It's got pretty good support so you stay pretty comfortable if you're sitting in it a while. I wish the back angle was more adjustable, as for me there's a little too much recline. My biggest complaint with this is it was a PAIN to put together. Trying to hold pieces up and fit screws into holes that aren't really lined up well was difficult, particularly with holding the whole backrest up. There has got to be a better way to engineer that.
customer_reviews.author: Katy J

customer_reviews.title: Affordable comfy chair
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was a bit difficult but aside from that, It's a decent chair. I work from home, sitting on my non-existent butt for 8-10 hours a day and it's a comfortable chair. It's not too hard for my non-existent butt which is pretty important for peoples like me with no booty meat cushion to speak of. My boyfriend thinks this chair is great, too apparently because he likes to steal it whenever I'm not sitting in it. It's a great chair for an affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: MamaMissy7

customer_reviews.title: Was great at first, but that fades quickly
customer_reviews.text: The design of the chair is fine. My issue is the quality of the materials they used...in particular, the seat cushion. Within just a few months of daily use, the seat has lost all its "fluff" and I can now feel the base plate of the chair against my butt when I sit down. To be clear, I'm a slender guy (140# soaking wet)...the cushion stuffing should not have worn out this quickly! Real bummer cuz the chair is nice otherwise...but what good is a chair that isn't comfortable to sit in after just a few months!?
customer_reviews.author: Michael R

customer_reviews.title: I replaced our dining chairs with these.
customer_reviews.text: We needed now dining chairs. Since we spend a lot of time at the table with games, or crafts, I decided to get these instead of traditional dining chairs. They look great, everyone loves them, there really comfortable, and the arms go up so the roll under the table. Frankly, these are far superior to actual dining chairs in every way. Also, dining tables take up too much space to only be used for dining.
customer_reviews.author: Geekoid

customer_reviews.title: I'm liking this chair...
customer_reviews.text: even though I'm not a gamer. It's a real deal at the price. As mentioned by others, attaching the back requires some finesse. You need a good source of lighting to make sure of the alignment. I'm always paranoid about stripping threads, so it took some extra time for me. A second set of hands would have been helpful. I can sit comfortably in this chair without the need of an extra support cushion, which is a real rarity for me. If you're in the market for a chair, put this one on your short list. There are also other color combinations available.
customer_reviews.author: geemaniac

customer_reviews.title: Good chair.. At first... Broke after a month. DO NOT BUY THIS CHAIR.
customer_reviews.text: I received this chair on April 29th 2020.This chair was decent at first. I little bit difficult to assemble, but not the worst. Pretty comfy and worked well considering the price. Then a month and a half later, on June 14th 2020, the chair broke. It will not recline and is just stuck in a stiff straight up and down position which kind of defeats the purpose. I don't want to sit at a 90 degree angle all day while working and gaming. Waste of money. DO NOT BUY THIS CHAIR.
customer_reviews.author: Sydney Kinamn-Vantiger

customer_reviews.title: Decent Chair with Some Assembly Issues
customer_reviews.text: This chair is a replacement to my old (and aged) office chair. Since I'm a gamer, I finally decided to go for an official "Gaming Chair". Overall, I'm happy this first night with the chair (no, we're not sleeping together). However, I was not too thrilled by the difficulty to assemble the damn thing! I thought I could do it alone (I'm used to that sort of thing), but there was no way when it came to the penultimate step of securing the seat back. I waited until The Boss came home, and even with her help, we struggled to finally assemble the chair. And it wasn't pretty!
customer_reviews.author: Maxlactica

customer_reviews.title: A bit stiff
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this chair for a week now. This chair was easy to put together and it looks nice, and it is relatively comfortable. However, the cushions are a bit stiff and the lumbar support is not adjustable at all. So if you slouch or are looking to go completely limp in this chair, it wont exactly let you. The only adjustments you can make are to lean the chair back or to raise/lower it, so dont expect to make it completely form to your personal sitting style. But for the price, I cannot really complain to hard about the chair's overall comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle L.

product_meta.title: OFM Essentials Collection Racing Style Bonded Leather Gaming Chair, in Green
product_meta.description: The OFM Essentials Collection seating is where quality meets value - and now it's taking the desk chair to a whole new level with the ESS-3085 series. This Racing Style Bonded Leather Gaming Chair, in Green, was designed with ergonomics in mind. With contoured segmented padding, a high back, and integrated headrest and lumbar support, this chair provides high-performance comfort whether used during intense gaming sessions or long work days. The thickly padded armrests can be left down for upper body support or flipped up to allow for uninhibited movement whenever you need it. Additional features include seat height adjustment, tilt-lock/tilt-tension control, and 360-degree swivel. SofThread Leather and contrasting color mesh upholstery complete the modern, high-quality look and feel. This chair is backed by our Essentials by OFM Limited Lifetime Warranty and features a 275 lb weight capacity.
feature_bullets: COMPUTER GAMING CHAIR: A race car style chair that provides luxury and comfort whether used during intense gaming sessions or long workdays
ERGONOMIC SWIVEL CHAIR: With contoured segmented padding, integrated padded headrest, and padded arms, this video game chair provides quality support and comfort for hours of play
ADJUSTABLE RACING CHAIR: Features height adjustment, center-tilt control, flip-up arms and 360 degrees of swivel
PREMIUM LEATHER CHAIR: Upholstered in SofThread Leather and contrasting colored upholstery for an aggressive style and cool feel
DURABLE OFFICE FURNITURE: This heavy duty chair has a 275 lb weight capacity for long-lasting use

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars9,042 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
